note.p: Death: 2 Sumner Place, Onslow Square, London (27 February 1913)
Education: Giggleswick School; Marlborough College; King's College, London; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1878), MA (1881)

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge (1880); Tutor, Trinity College (1897-1907); Lecturer in Animal Morphology, Cambridge University (1883-1890); Reader in Animal Morphology (1890-1907); Professor of Zoology and Comparative Anatomy (1907-1909); Professor of Zoology, Imperial College, London (1909-1913); Chairman, Geological Survey of Great Britain
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1912-1913 vol 86 pp xxiv-xxix signed by E W M
